title: Does ‘ABA’ Letter Prove Anyone Making COVID-19 Masks Can Be Sued?
subtitle: A letter falsely attributed to the Ohio State Bar Association made some questionable claims.
author: Nur Ibrahim
vclaim: A July 2020 letter purportedly sent by the Ohio State Bar Association (OSBA) was accurate in stating that any retailer or manufacturer — including those operating from homes — could be sued for selling or creating COVID-19 protective face masks that were not medically approved, defective, or without proper labeling.
